Posts.Content: Hi, I am a 3 year breast cancer survivor.  Recently I have been very fatigued.  I have also had pain in my stomach under the left rib cage.  I have had a full CT scan and the only thing that came back was I have a nodule on my thyroid.  I also have nausea daily at all different times of the day.For the last couple of months I have a pain in my ear and it travels down my neck.  The doctor says it is not an ear infection but puts me on antibiotics, it goes away and then it comes back after.  This is now the 3rd time.  I get shortness of breath and have a slight cough.  My blood counts are ok except my glucose is high.  I also get bruising , sometimes after just sleeping.  My platlet count is 234.  Anyone have any suggestions?  My uncle died of mylediplasia and always had ear infections until they figured it out.  Any thoughts would help! Lor
Posts.Title: strange pains -concerned with reaccurance

Posts.Content: On 7/31/2008 Leemg wrote: Not familiar with your uncle's condition but I would agree with the other response and definitely pursue this.  Have you had any MRI's?  CT's, I believe are for bony structures, MRI's are for soft tissue.  How about a PET?  Something isn't quite right so you owe it to yourself to try to get to the bottom of it all.  Good luck! Hi thanks for your advice.  My uncle's condition is a leukemia.  I asked about a PET scan and the doctor's didn't think it would help.  I will continue to look for answers.
Posts.Title: strange pains -concerned with reaccurance

Posts.Content: Hi I was wondering if anyone has had these symptoms 4 years after breast cancer?  I was HER2 postive and had ACT and herceptin and radiation.  I have been experiencing sternum pain that radiates around to my back in the ribcage.  It is not on the same side as my breast cancer.  I had a lumpectomy on the left and 3 lymoph nodes were postive.  I had a full bone scan last week and I am scheduled for a CT scan with contrast this week.  I am worried that the pain is in the sternum but may be coming from my lungs.  I have some shortness of breath and I am fatigued.  It also hurts when I go out in the cold.  Any suggestions or if anyone has had this happen to them please let me know. SCARED. LJMA
Posts.Title: Sternum and breast bone pain 4 years after breast cancer

Posts.Content: On 8/1/2008 Fight the Good Fight wrote:   On 7/31/2008 LJMA5 wrote: Hi, I am a 3 year breast cancer survivor.  Recently I have been very fatigued.  I have also had pain in my stomach under the left rib cage.  I have had a full CT scan and the only thing that came back was I have a nodule on my thyroid.  I also have nausea daily at all different times of the day.For the last couple of months I have a pain in my ear and it travels down my neck.  The doctor says it is not an ear infection but puts me on antibiotics, it goes away and then it comes back after.  This is now the 3rd time.  I get shortness of breath and have a slight cough.  My blood counts are ok except my glucose is high.  I also get bruising , sometimes after just sleeping.  My platlet count is 234.  Anyone have any suggestions?  My uncle died of mylediplasia and always had ear infections until they figured it out.  Any thoughts would help! Lor Hi, I have been battling breast cancer and chemo related problems for the last year and can relate. I was told I was clean of my breast cancer w/o a pet scan being done.  I had severe reactions to many of the chemo drugs and doctor felt it would be in my best interest to stop chemo 3 sessions early.  I too, have been having severe bone pain and my stomache always seems to either be nauseas or in pain on my right side under my ribcage.  I was in the hopsital for several days for the pain that they  blamed on an obstructed bowel.  I started getting high blood pressure and edima and after finally having a pet scan ordered, they found another mass that is quite large behind my sternam and between my spine.  They believe it is cancer and are doing my biopsy next week.  Keep on your doctor about this,  I have no cancer markers in my blood, but neither did I when they found my stage 3 breast cancer.  Good luck and be persistant!!!Hi thank you for your advice.  I am seeing a GI doc on thursday.  Good luck on your biopsy.  Isn't it frustrating sometimes?  I'll let you know.
Posts.Title: strange pains -concerned with reaccurance
